docs.snippet: Arkansas’s 84.4-percentage-point disparity between its winning percentages at home (94.4 percent) and on the road (10 percent) is the highest in Division I....
docs.lead_paragraph: Arkansas’s 84.4-percentage-point disparity between its winning percentages at home (94.4 percent) and on the road (10 percent) is the highest in Division I.
docs.abstract: Arkansas men's basketball team has a 94.4 percent win rate at home, while winning only 10 percent of their games on the road, highest disparity in Division 1 college basketball.

headline.seo: Arkansas, Successful at Home, Struggles on Road
headline.main: When Arkansas Travels, Success Doesn’t Follow
headline.print_headline: When Arkansas Travels, Success Doesn’t Follow

docs.snippet: After a federal judge’s ruling on betting, the N.C.A.A. lifted a recent ban against New Jersey colleges, allowing them to host tournament games or championships....
docs.lead_paragraph: After a federal judge’s ruling on betting, the N.C.A.A. lifted a recent ban against New Jersey colleges, allowing them to host tournament games or championships.
docs.abstract: NCAA lifts ban against New Jersey colleges, allowing them to host tournament games or championships; move follows permanent injunction in United States District Court barring state from offering sports betting.

headline.seo: After Judge’s Ruling on Betting, N.C.A.A. Drops Ban for New Jersey Teams
headline.main: N.C.A.A. Drops Ban of Finals in New Jersey
headline.print_headline: N.C.A.A. Drops Ban of Finals in New Jersey

docs.snippet: Facebook plans to announce a substantial redesign of its News Feed — a makeover aimed both at keeping users glued to the social network and luring more advertising dollars....
docs.lead_paragraph: Facebook plans to announce a substantial redesign of its News Feed — a makeover aimed both at keeping users glued to the social network and luring more advertising dollars.
docs.abstract: Facebook plans to announce substantial redesign of its News Feed, makeover aimed both at keeping users glued to site and luring more advertising dollars; company executives say they want to make the News Feed, first page every user sees upon logging in, more relevant.

headline.seo: Facebook’s Redesign Hopes to Keep Users Engaged
headline.main: Face-Lift at Facebook, to Keep Its Users Engaged
headline.print_headline: Face-Lift at Facebook, to Keep Its Users Engaged

docs.snippet: With government workers facing furloughs and pay cuts, President Obama is sure to face criticism about activities like golf outings....
docs.lead_paragraph: With government workers facing furloughs and pay cuts, President Obama is sure to face criticism about activities like golf outings.
docs.abstract: Pres Obama, with government workers facing furloughs and pay cuts, is sure to face criticism about activities like golf outings; months ahead will be tricky for him on whether or not to adjust his family's activities.

headline.seo: Spending Cuts Complicate Obama’s Free Time
headline.main: Amid Cuts, Does a President Dare Tee Off?
headline.print_headline: Amid Cuts, Does a President Dare Tee Off?

docs.snippet:
The Roger Ailes book wars have begun. 
   
On Wednesday Vanity Fair’s Web site published an excerpt from the first of two — or maybe three — books about Mr. Ailes and the network he runs, the Fox News Channel....
docs.lead_paragraph:
The Roger Ailes book wars have begun. 
 
On Wednesday Vanity Fair’s Web site published an excerpt from the first of two — or maybe three — books about Mr. Ailes and the network he runs, the Fox News Channel.
docs.abstract: Vanity Fair's Web site publishes excerpt from Zev Chafets upcoming book Roger Ailes: Off Camera, biography of Fox News chairman Roger Ailes; book precedes another by Gabriel Sherman, tentatively titled The Loudest Voice in the Room: Fox News and the Making of America. Photo (M)

headline.main: One Book About Roger Ailes Gets a Jump on Another

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: THE LOUDEST VOICE IN THE ROOM: FOX NEWS AND THE MAKING OF AMERICA
